text.text:
The Marketing Cloud is an integrated family of digital marketing solutions, as well as an intuitive interface for new resources and capabilities called core services. If you are new to the Marketing Cloud, Learn more on Adobe.com.

Popular Topics

  • Get started
  • Learn about profiles and audiences
  • Create an audience
  • Publish audience segments from Analytics

Share and Collaborate

Release Notes & Solution Help

  • Release Notes - All Solutions
  • Marketing Cloud Help Home
  • About Solutions

Administration

Core Services

  • Profiles and Audiences
  • Dynamic tag management
  • Mobile Services

Blogs

  • Marketing Cloud Overview
  • Core Services Overview
  • Profile Management in Adobe Marketing Cloud

Community Resources

  • Marketing Cloud Forum
  • Adobe Marketing Cloud Community
  • Idea Exchange
  • Adobe Training and Tutorials
  • Featured Solutions Center

Developer

Authenticate using OAuth2, calling the web services APIs.

Task Description

Get access

Important: Before you can sign in, your administrator must contact Adobe for company provisioning. Administrators also need to create groups and add users.

See Administration - Getting Started for instructions.

Collaborate

Bring team members together through the common working environment in Adobe Marketing Cloud. Each contributor is able to share reports, content, assets, and feedback in real time.

Leverage core services like Audiences.

Core services like Audiences integrate with Marketing Cloud solutions. For example, you can create audiences, combine existing audiences to create composite audiences, and view all shared audiences.

To access the Marketing Cloud, you must link your solution credentials with your Adobe ID. If you do not have an Adobe ID, you can create one prior to linking your accounts.

For example, in Analytics and Social, link (or map) the Company, Username, and Password values to your Adobe ID.

To access the Marketing Cloud

  1. Verify that your company has been provisioned.

    Administrators perform this step. Provisioning enables users to link their solution credentials to the Marketing Cloud Adobe ID.

  2. In your solution, click Join Marketing Cloud.

    This button launches a wizard that helps you link your solution credentials to your Adobe ID.

  3. Sign in and start using the Marketing Cloud.

    After you link your accounts, you can access all of your Adobe Digital Marketing products and services at .marketing.adobe.com.

You can also link accounts using on the Organizations page.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Join the Marketing Cloud from a Solution

text.text:
Linking accounts from the Manage Organizations is the recommended process to link solution accounts.

Join Marketing Cloud

If you see the Join Marketing Cloud button in a solution, your organization has been correctly provisioned. The solution you are in can be linked to that organization.

Clicking this button displays a wizard for you to link accounts. This process maps your solution credentials to your Adobe ID.

Adobe Target users can be similarly link email and password accounts to the Marketing Cloud. See Set Up Users and Roles in Target Help for more information.

Having Trouble - Password Recovery

If you receive an error when linking accounts, you might need to recover your solution password. Depending on the solution you are using, you may have a different password recovery process.

Generally, to recover a password:

  1. Navigate to your solution login page.
  2. Click Forgot Password.

    For Adobe Analytics users, navigate to sc2.omniture.com/password_recovery.html.

Resetting a solution password should resolve password linking issues for Marketing Cloud account linking.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Sign in to the Adobe Marketing Cloud

text.text:
• Verify with your administrator that your company has been provisioned in the Marketing Cloud.

    See .

  • Navigate to the Adobe Marketing Cloud at .marketing.adobe.com.
  • Click Sign In With Adobe ID.
  • Type your credentials, then click Sign In.

    If you have solutions that remain unlinked, you can link them on this page.

  • Click Continue to Marketing Cloud.

What Is an Organization?

A Marketing Cloud organization is the entity that enables an administrator to configure groups and users, and to control single sign-on in the Marketing Cloud. The organization functions like a log-in company that spans all the Marketing Cloud products and solutions. Most often, an organization is your company name. However, a company can have many organizations.

Organizations are displayed as tabs on the Manage Organizations page, but you can also identify the organization in the domain name, and set the organization as the default landing.

Each Organization has a unique Marketing Cloud ID. Organizations are displayed as tabs on the Organizations & Products Access page only after Adobe has provisioned the Company.

When an administrator of an Organization invites a user to the Marketing Cloud, adding the user to a the Organization displays on this page.

Cards correspond to a solution. For example, an Analytics log-in company generally has a 1:1 correlation with an Organization.

• Click Organizations.

  • Click Get Access.

  • Select a solution, then type your solution credentials.

    For example, type the Company (for Analytics and Social), Username, and Password fields.

  • Click Link Accounts.
  • (Optional) Enable Set as default organization.

    You may have access to multiple organizations (also called tenants). Organizations are displayed as tabs on this page, but you can also identify it in the domain name, and specify this organization as the default landing.

    For example, in xyz.marketing.adobe.com, xyz is the organization. If you set xyz as the default organization, navigating to marketing.adobe.com will direct you to xyz.marketing.adobe.com.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Link accounts in the Marketing Cloud

text.text:
The preferred account linking method is to use the button from within a solution.

  • Click Organizations.

  • Click Get Access.

  • Select a solution, then type your solution credentials.

    Your credentials include Username and Password. For Analytics and Social, your credentials also include Company.

  • Click Link.

Tools Page - Descriptions

Marketing Cloud > Tools

Element Description

User Management

See

Group Management

See

Identify

Manage user Identity type, password policies, and login restrictions.

Dynamic Tag Management

Manage deployment of Marketing Cloud solutions at dtm.adobe.com.

For product documentation, see Dynamic Tag Management Help.

Marketing Cloud ID

The Marketing Cloud Organization ID. This is the ID associated with your provisioned Marketing Cloud company. An Organization is the entity that enables an administrator to configure groups and users, and to control single sign-on in the Marketing Cloud. This ID is a 24-character alphanumeric string.

@AdobeOrg is required as part of the Organization ID for implementing the Marketing Cloud visitor ID service.

Getting Started Tasks
Step Who Performs Where Why

Complete the Opt-In Application.

Administrators

Adobe Marketing Cloud Interface Opt-In Application

Completing the form notifies the Adobe Customer Provisioning Team (CPT) to provision your account. Then, the CPT notifies the Account Manager you specified on the form. Your Account Manager then contacts you.

Once enabled as an administrator, you can access the Tools page in the Marketing Cloud, where you can:

  • Create users
  • Create groups
  • Invite users to the Marketing Cloud

Create one or more groups.

Administrators

ToolsGroup Management

A Group is a container of users. You add users to a group, then enable solution access at the group level.

Add (invite) users to the Marketing Cloud organization.

Administrators

ToolsUser Management

You can also perform this step on the Edit Group page, under Solution Access.

When you invite a user to the Marketing Cloud organization, you specify their email addresses and can associate them with a group.

Adobe sends the users an email invitation. They must confirm their email address by clicking a link in the email, which registers the account. (See step 4.)

If the new user does not yet exist in your solution (Analytics, Social, or Target), Adobe recommends the following workflow to add the user:

  1. Add the user as you typically do. (For example, in Analytics, use Admin Tools > User Management.)
  2. Instruct the user log in to the solution, then click Join Marketing Cloud, and follow the steps to link accounts.

See for more information.

Link solution accounts. (Join Marketing Cloud)

Users

In solutions (Analytics, Social, etc.) or In the Marketing Cloud.

Linking accounts connects a user's Adobe ID (Marketing Cloud login) to the user's solution credentials. After users sign in to .marketing.adobe.com, they are automatically signed in to the solution.

See for more information.

(Optional) Implement the Marketing Cloud Visitor ID Service

Administrators

See

See for questions and answers about the Marketing Cloud.

Question Answer

How does the Marketing Cloud relate to solutions?

The Marketing Cloud provides a framework for accessing the solutions, as well as functionality for cross-solution workflows like dynamic tag management and audience management.

Does Adobe charge my company for Marketing Cloud access?

No. The Marketing Cloud is included at no additional charge. However, certain core services might have additional costs.

Why does my company need to log in through the Marketing Cloud interface?

The functionality provided by the Marketing Cloud interface adds new value to your business. It also will be the standard path for accessing solutions going forward, eventually replacing other individual solution login flows. Logging in through the Marketing Cloud will facilitate a smoother transition later.

How do I resolve concerns about migrating my company?

Contact Adobe Support.

What is provisioning?

Provisioning in the Marketing Cloud means:

  • Your users can begin logging in to the Marketing Cloud and linking solutions.
  • They can begin to use the features available through the Marketing cloud, such as Master Marketing Profile Audiences. Users can collaborate using cards and boards, and use upcoming functionality.
  • You can become prepared to retire your solution-specific login process.
  • You can retain access control to solutions.

Adobe recommends joining the Marketing Cloud, but you are not obligated to join at this time.

What action do I need to take to facilitate this process?

  1. Once your company has been provisioned with access, Adobe emails the administrator with an invitation to the interface. The administrator can log in and begin to learn about the user and group management functionality of the Marketing Cloud.
  2. At the same time, your users start seeing a Join Marketing Cloud button in the top right of the screen when they log in to Adobe solutions.

    This button guides them through the process of linking their solution account to the Marketing Cloud. No action is required by you.

    above

    See for more information.

How do I manage user accounts?

User accounts in the Marketing Cloud can be found under the Tools menu.

No action is required from you for your users to begin using the Marketing Cloud and linking their solution accounts. However, when want to manage users, you can create groups and invite new users from Tools.

If you do not see the Tools menu, you are not an administrator. See above for more information.

What do I do if someone cannot log in to the Marketing Cloud interface?

  1. Verify whether users see the Join Marketing Cloud button when they log in to an Adobe solution like Analytics.

    If they do, please contact Adobe Support and indicate that a particular user is having trouble with their Adobe ID.

  2. If they do not see the Join Marketing Cloud button, contact Adobe Support to indicate that your company has not been fully provisioned.

What if a user does not see the Join Marketing Cloud button?

Your company has not been fully provisioned for the Marketing Cloud. Contact Adobe Support.

What do I do if account linking fails?

Contact Adobe Support.

You can still access your solution using the standard login while the issue is being solved.

I know my company has [solution name]. Why don't I see it for linking?

Your company has not been fully provisioned for the Marketing Cloud.

Contact Adobe Support.

Where can I find my IMS organization ID?

Adobe Customer Support can look this up for you. (This ID is needed for implementing a number of Marketing Cloud capabilities, such as Audiences).

What do I do if someone cannot access a solution from the Marketing Cloud interface?

If they do not see a menu option for a solution to which they have access, have the user log in to that solution directly. Then, click Join Marketing Cloud to complete the linking process. Users need to link each account to the Marketing Cloud.

What should I do with groups?

Groups let you manage people and grant access to solutions or capabilities.

During your initial adoption of the Marketing Cloud, you do not need to create groups. The linking process automatically places users in groups that have access to solutions.

However, as new people join your teams, you might want to create new groups and assign solutions to those groups, for group access levels.

How does the Marketing Cloud change my user management processes?

For now, not much.

As new people join your teams, continue to create accounts for them in the solutions. Have them log in to the solutions and click Join Marketing Cloud to link their account.

Some functionality is managed directly within the Marketing Cloud interface, such as Audiences. In the future, you will be able to create solution accounts for your users from the Marketing Cloud, and the linking process will be unnecessary. We are in a transition process currently, but ultimately your users will have only one login for all of their Adobe solutions, including Creative Cloud solutions.

What should I do when one of my users leaves my company?

Their access should be removed from the solution itself. They will not be able to access the product from the Marketing Cloud or through the direct login. You should also remove them at the Marketing Cloud level.

What is an Adobe ID?

An Adobe ID is the user's account for all Adobe solutions. Users create their own Adobe IDs in the process of linking their solution accounts to the Marketing Cloud.

As an Admin, you have control over password policies for your Marketing Cloud users. Your users decide which email address they will use when they create their Adobe ID. In the near future, you will be able to create IDs for your users directly.

How do I integrate my company's single sign-in with the Marketing Cloud?

We will be releasing a single sign-on integration capability soon. Please contact your Account Manager to indicate interest.

What does unlinking do?

If you unlink your solution, you cannot access your solution through the Marketing Cloud. Linking again will need to occur to regain access through the Marketing Cloud. Unlinking does not remove the solution account, so users can still access the solution directly.

Where can a user go in the Marketing Cloud to manage linking?

OrganizationsAccount SettingsOrganization & Product Access

.

See .

Can I link solution accounts for my users?

No.

Users must link their own solutions with their user names and passwords.

Why do I see Social when my company does not have it?

Adobe Social is a product that can be sold with Analytics. Therefore, if you have Analytics you will see this solution, but you will not have access unless you have purchased it.

How should I manage solution access?

Solution access will still be managed through the solution itself, for the time being. In the near future, solution access controls will be available in the Marketing Cloud.

How do I share a report or a campaign to the Marketing Cloud?

An Analytics report or a campaign are examples of assets that you can share to a board (a collection of cards). The steps are similar in every solution.

For an example, see:

See .

What are cards, boards, and feeds?

  • A Feed is where you see all that is happening. You can monitor the latest changes in your assets and campaigns, and navigate to a more detailed view in an individual card.

  • A Board is a collection of cards. It's where you collaborate around marketing campaigns, products, reports or a creative asset.

  • A Card reflects the performance of the asset and campaign. You can pin a card to a board for instant access to the asset.

What are audiences?

Audiences are collections of visitors. Creating and managing audiences is similar to creating and using segments, with the addition of the ability to share them to the Marketing Cloud.

See .

Marketing CloudTools

Element Description

User Management

Add users to your organization. Emails are sent to invited users.

See

Group Management

Create a group, and add users to the group. You can enable access to a solution at the group level. For example, you can create a group that has Analytics rights, and add users to the group.

See

Identity

View and manage identity types, password policies, and login restrictions.

Before sending an email invitation to a Marketing Cloud user, you must add the new user via

ToolsUser Management

. Removing a user from the Marketing Cloud does not remove the user from other solutions, such as Target or Analytics.

See for information about linking a solution log-in to the Adobe ID.
ToolsUser Management

jcr:content.jcr:title: Invite a user to the Marketing Cloud

text.text:
• as an administrator.
  • In the Marketing Cloud, click Tools, then click User Management.
  • Click Send New Invite.

  • Type the email address of the user you want to invite to the Marketing Cloud.

  • In the Add Groups field, specify a group to which you want to add the user.

  • Click Add.

    When you add users, they are invited by email. The email recipient must click Accept in the email, which confirms the address. At that point, the account is registered, and users can by linking the Adobe ID to their solution credentials.

When removing a user, the user's details are removed from your organization. However, the Adobe ID remains valid and can still be used for other Adobe services.

  • Click Tools, then click User Management.
  • To remove an existing user, select the box next to the user's name on the Active Users tab.

  • Click Remove.

    To revoke a pending invitation, click the Pending Users tab, then click Revoke.

You must be an administrator to perform this procedure.

  • In the Marketing Cloud, click Tools.
  • Click Creative Cloud User Management.
  • Click Add New User.
  • Type an email, display name, title, and optionally add an Avatar.
  • Click Create.

A Group is a container for users. You add users to the group, then enable access to a solution at the group level. For example, you can create a group that has Analytics rights, and add users to the group. Contact Customer Care if you are an administrator but do not see the Tools link.

March release for group mapping. UI changing for groups. See 1:Many Mapping PDF in follow-up email list. Vineet 12/15.

What is it Changing the MC architecture to allow multiple product contexts to map to a single IMS organization. This means that a customer organization can share to MAC with only one Target client, one Analytics login company, etc. Enables multiple product contexts of the same instances (more than one Analytics) Also known as "one to many" mapping.

Customer Value This mapping will allow a simplified org structure for customers with multiple products and multiple organizations. Additionally, the current 1:1 mapping rules are difficult to explain and hard to justify to customers, hindering Marketing Cloud adoption. The 1:many mapping provides a better and more flexible user experience. As customers are implementing the visitor ID service, they need to specify the IMS org ID, right now they need to choose which IMS org ID they need to use, even though data is being collected in various report suites across various log in companies. The one to many mapping will allow customers to effectively implement visitor ID service

Adobe Value Facilitates complete migration of customers to the Marketing Cloud. Simplifies implementation of multi-org multi-solution customers. Enables Visitor ID service.

ToolsGroup Management

The following table describes the interface elements available on the Group Management page and when adding or editing a group.

Element Description

Group Name

(Required) The name of the group account. This name is displayed on the Group Management page.

Description

A user-defined description of your group. This description displays in Group Management.

Group Members

Names, username (email), and the titles for group members.

Add New Members to Group

Lets you specify the email of an existing Marketing Cloud user to add to this group.

See .

Solution Access

Lets you assign the group access to the Marketing Cloud and solutions.

To enable single sign-on between the Marketing Cloud and a solution, users must join the marketing cloud by linking the accounts.

Number of users

The number of users in the group.

When you add users, they are invited by email. The email recipient must click Accept in the email, which confirms the address. At that point, the account is registered.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Create a group in the Marketing Cloud

text.text:
• as an administrator.
  • In the Marketing Cloud, click Tools, then click Group Management.
  • Click Add.
  • Type a name for the group, and an optional description.
  • To add (invite) users to the group, type the user's email address in the Add New Members to the Group field.

    When you add users, they are invited by email. The email recipient must click Accept in the email, which confirms the address. At that point, the account is registered.

  • Under Solution Access, enable the solution to which you want the group to have access.
  • Click Save.

    The new group displays on the Group Management page.

• Microsoft Internet Explorer 9 or higher
  • Google Chrome
  • Mozilla Firefox
  • Apple Safari
Click the user icon, then click Account Settings.

Asset services include:

  • Asset storage, management interface, embedded selection interface (accessed through solutions)
  • Integrations with Creative Cloud, Marketing Cloud collaboration, and Marketing Cloud solutions.

Using Assets in the Marketing cloud enables teams to use centralized, approved assets across channels and customer experiences. Using assets improves consistency and brand compliance, and speeds time to market. You can streamline workflows in solutions:

  • Social: Publish to social properties, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+
  • Target: Create experiences for A/B and multivariate tests.
  • Media Optimizer: Develop ad units across different channels and campaigns
  • Campaign: Place assets into email newsletters and campaigns.
Asset Sharing with Experience Manager

You can share assets within Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Assets with the Marketing Cloud and Adobe Creative Cloud. Any changes to these assets are reflected in the shared copies of the assets in Marketing Cloud and Creative Cloud. Similarly, any changes you make to the shared copies of the assets from within Marketing Cloud and Creative Cloud are reflected in the original assets in AEM Assets.

See Synchronizing AEM assets with MAC and CC for more information.

AOD/Core Services 2015 wiki

https://wiki.corp.adobe.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=970396852

Remove MMP; lowercase visitor ID; get How it Works from Aaron. Add to solution discussion, promote to Section.

  • How to define an audience
What Are Audiences?

Audiences are collections of visitors (a list of visitor IDs). Adobe's audience services manages the translation of visitor data into audience segmentation. As such, creating and managing audiences is similar to creating and using segments, with the added ability to share the audience segment to the Marketing Cloud.

Audiences can be created or derived from various sources, such as:

  • New ones created in the Marketing Cloud
  • From Analytics segments published to the Marketing Cloud
  • From audience management

Real-Time vs. Historical Audiences

All audiences, regardless of where they are sourced, are accessible for real-time targeting use cases. The system evaluates audiences in two ways:

  • Historical audiences are sourced from analytics are evaluated every 12 hours. Historical audiences always include return visitors.
  • Real-time audiences are sourced in the audience library are evaluated real time.

For implementation steps, see .

How Solutions Use Audiences

Some examples of how to use audiences in Marketing Cloud solutions:

Solution Description

Marketing Cloud Audience Library

Create, manage, and share audiences natively using the Audience Library interface. You can:

  • Use real-time audiences using raw analytics attributes
  • Combine audiences to create composite ones, joining real-time and historical data
  • See graphical views of estimated audiences size

Analytics

In reporting and ad hoc analysis segmentation, you can build a segment, combine it with a report suite, and then publish the segment to the Marketing Cloud.

Publishing the segment displays it on the Audience Library page. The audience is also available as a targeted audience for a campaign experience delivered by Adobe Target, and in audience management.

Once an audience is shared from Analytics, and selected for use in an active campaign, all of the visitor profiles who met the segment definition criteria for the past 90 days are sent to the Marketing Cloud Audience Services platform.

Mobile Services

Analyze mobile traffic using the sunburst visualization in the Device Types report.

Target

The Marketing Cloud visitor ID service unifies visitor IDs and data into a single, actionable profile for use across solutions.

The Publish to the Marketing Cloud checkbox during the segment creation process in Adobe Analytics allows the segment to be available within the Adobe Target's custom audience library. A segment created in Analytics or audience management can be used for activities in Target.

For example, you can create campaign activities based on Analytics conversion metrics and audience segments created in Analytics.

Media Optimizer

Audience management: Shared audiences are available in audience management segmentation in Media Optimizer. All Marketing Cloud audiences are available natively in audience management, which provides:

  • Built-in automation regarding how they are shared and consumed in solution workflows
  • Offsite destinations
  • Look-alike modeling

Advertising management: Use the audience as targets.

Audiences Library - Interface Descriptions

The Marketing Cloud provides a library for creating and managing audiences, with native, real-time audience identification.

Marketing CloudAudiences

Interface Elements

Element Description

New

Lets you create an audience.

Title & Description

A column heading that identifies and describes the audience.

Author

The person who created the audience segment.

Source

Identifies where the audience was created.

Analytics: A segment created in reports & analytics or ad hoc analysis, then published to the Marketing Cloud.

Marketing Cloud: A new audience created in the Audience Library.

Audience Manager: Audiences created audience management (Media Optimizer) automatically display in the Audience Library.

Current Size

The current audience size.

Active

The active status of the segment.

Limitations in Using Audience Library

If you do not use the audience management capability in Media Optimizer, the following limits exist:

Limit Description

Audiences created wholly or partially* in Analytics segmentation.

Up to 20 of these can be active in a campaign at any time. There is no limit to the number of audiences that can be flagged in Analytics as available to the audience service in the Marketing Cloud. However, only 20 can be active at once.

(*Partially indicates an audience that is a combination of data derived from Analytics, plus the real-time values collected in the Audience Library.)

Audiences built natively in the Marketing Cloud Audience Library.

The limit is 50 at any time.

Traits built natively in Marketing Cloud Audience Library.

The limit is 100 at any time.

There is no limit to the number of managed profiles or to the number of users that can be assigned to a single audience.

Additional limitations:

Limit Description

Additional limits associated with shared profiles

  • Non-Marketing Cloud destinations for audiences are not allowed.
  • Audience management data integration capabilities are not available. 1st, 2nd, or 3rd-party data cannot be brought in through audience management.
  • Reporting functionality is also limited compared to audience management.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Implement profiles and audiences in the Marketing Cloud

text.text:
Administrators, before proceeding you should have already contacted Adobe to provision your company in the Marketing Cloud. To do so, complete the Adobe Marketing Cloud Interface Opt-In Application.

See for more information.

Raw analytics data collected in the real-time audiences framework does not recognize the IP obfuscation available for Adobe Analytics customers. Customers who currently use IP obfuscation in Analytics are encouraged to review their data collection and privacy policies before requesting real-time audience enablement to avoid violating these policies.

CNAME support coming in

https://issues.adobe.com/browse/AN-85429

https://wiki.corp.adobe.com/display/omtrcache/1st+Party+and+Friendly+3rd+Party+Domain+Support+for+Marketing+Cloud+Visitor+ID+Service#id-1stPartyandFriendly3rdPartyDomainSupportforMarketingCloudVisitorIDService-Solution

Set the flag to indicate you are a CNAME customer when implementing the VisID. Set to host name you're using for data collection. Luby.

Implementation Requirements

Account Management serves as the point of contact for Profiles and Audiences activation.

Step

Description

Ensure that you have an Analytics Solution SKU.

You must have the Adobe Analytics Solution SKU (not the legacy SiteCatalyst SKU). The Analytics Solution SKU became available in 2013.

You must also have an Adobe Target Solution SKU (Target Standard, Target Premium, or Target Classic).

Use the regional data collection service (RDC)

If your data collection domain is omtrdc.net, or if your CNAME is mapped to omtrdc.net, you are on RDC.

If you are using first-party cookies, see CNAME and the Visitor ID Service.

Configure the Marketing Cloud visitor ID service, and update specified implementation files.

Perform the following JavaScript implementation steps:

  1. Implement the visitor ID service.

    Perform the steps described in Marketing Cloud Visitor ID Service Implementation.

  2. Update your existing s_code to version H.27 or later, or your existing AppMeasurement.js to version 1.3 or later.

    These files are available for download in the Code Manager.

    If necessary, see the Analytics Implementation reference guide for information about a JavaScript implementation.

  3. (Optional) Implement Analytics for Target.

    Refresh the mbox.js implementation for Target (version 48 or later).

Request access to the audience service.

Complete the Audiences Services Access Request form.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Data Storage and Privacy Disclosure Information

text.text:
If you leverage real-time audience profiling and other core services within the Adobe Marketing Cloud (via the Master Marketing Profile), use of these services might impact which data center (and country) your data resides. Specifically, because the core services of the Adobe Marketing Cloud leverage Adobe audience management, data used within the Master Marketing Profile must reside within audience management servers in the United States.

When leveraging core services made available via the Master Marketing Profile, the types of data sent from other Adobe products to audience management are:

  • Analytics key/value pairs (props, eVars, list vars, and so on). By default, the log lines include IP address, including the last octet of the IP (assuming that the IP address was not modified by IP obfuscation settings within Adobe Analytics).
  • Traits and segments that visitors qualify for based on rules set up in audience management.
  • (Optional) One or more of your IDs. Depending on your implementation of the ID service, you might also be sending in one or more of your IDs, such as CRM IDs or hashed email addresses. If this data is sent into Adobe Analytics, it is transferred to Adobe audience management.

    Adobe recommends against providing personal data to Adobe Analytics. Rather, use a one-way hash to pseudonymize the data before it is sent to Adobe.

  • Segments originating in Analytics via the back-end segment sharing capability.
  • The demdex.net cookie is set if third-party cookies are not blocked. The AMCV_###@AdobeOrg first-party cookie is always set with the Marketing Cloud Visitor ID.

All of these data elements are delivered to Adobe audience management in the form of log files. Audience management processes and stores this data within the United States. Audience management does not provide an option to store or process this data outside of the United States.

As a reminder, Adobe has certified under the US-EU Safe Harbor program. This certification covers all of the Adobe Marketing Cloud products. This program allows for Adobe to process and store personal data from EU residents in a manner compliant with the EU Data Protection Directive. In addition, the Adobe Marketing Cloud Security white paper describes Adobe's security practices for the Adobe Marketing Cloud, which includes Adobe audience management.

Cookies and Opt-Outs

Use of real-time audience profiling leverages the audience management cookie, in addition to the cookies used for Analytics and Target.

If you want to provide the proper opt-out ability, visitors to your site must add the audience management opt-out to your existing opt-out process.

See Adobe Marketing Cloud - Implementing Adobe Opt-Outs for instructions.

See Data Collection CNAMEs and Cross-Domain Tracking for enabling cross-domain tracking.

Tie this into the use case for CRS.

Tie into t_audience_target.xml, which is deleted from this section.

  • In marketing reports & analytics (or ad hoc analysis), create a segment.
  • On the Segment Builder, enable Publish to Marketing Cloud.

    Element Description

    Publish to Marketing Cloud (for )

    Publishes this segment to the Marketing Cloud. You can use the audience for marketing activities in Adobe Target and segmentation in audience management.

    The Title and Description fields are required for the segment to be published.

    When this option is enabled, the title and audience segment definition are shared, but actual data is not. When that audience is associated with an active campaign in Target, Analytics begins sending IDs for visitors that qualify for that audience. At that point, the audience name and corresponding data begins displaying on the Marketing Cloud Audiences page.

    In Analytics, you can edit or delete a published segment. If the segment is in use, a warning message is issued when you edit a segment. You cannot delete a published segment that is in use by Adobe Target.

    For information about enabling Audience Services, see Implementing Audience Services (MMP) in the Marketing Cloud.

    Data Privacy

    Audiences are not filtered based on the authentication state of a visitor. If a visitor can browse your site in un-authenticated and authenticated states, actions that occur when a visitor is un-authenticated can still cause a visitor to be included in an audience. Review Analytics Privacy Overview to understand the full privacy implications of audience sharing.

  • Click Save.
  • Access Adobe Target, then navigate to the Segment list.

  • On the Segment page, click Import Marketing Cloud Audiences

    This option displays the Analytics segment for use in activities.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Define rules for a composite audience

text.text:
This article helps you understand how to:

  • Create an audience
  • Create a rule
  • Use rules to define a composite audience

The following graphic represents two rules in a composite audience.

Each circle represents a rule that defines audience membership. Visitors that qualify as members in both audience rules overlap to become the composite, defined audience.

The audience is fully defined after data collection for the specified period completes.

The following example shows how to create the rules for a composite audience. This audience is comprised of:

  • Home & Garden section derived from page data, or raw analytics data.
  • Chrome and Safari users derived from an Adobe Analytics segment published to the Marketing Cloud.

  • In the Marketing Cloud, click Audiences.

  • On the Audiences page, click New.

  • On the Create New Audience page, specify a title and description.
  • Under Rules, select an attribute source:
    • Raw Analytics Data: Attribute (page) data derived from data collection, such as Analytics page variables (eVars), dynamic tag management, and other external sources.

      You must select a report suite when using this attribute source, and define the dimension or event to include. This report suite selection provides the variable structure used by the report suite.

    • Marketing Cloud: Attribute data derived from the Marketing Cloud sources. For example, this can be data from audience segments you create in Analytics (marketing reports & analytics, ad hoc analysis, report builder), and data from Media Optimizer (audience management).
  • Define audience rules.

    You should have an understanding of your implementation variables when defining audience rules.

    Under Rules, define the Home & Garden attribute selections:

    • Attribute Source: Raw Analytics Data
    • Report Suite: Report Suite 31
    • Dimension =

      Store (Merch) (v6)EqualsHome & Garden

    The Chrome & Safari Visitors is an audience segment shared from Analytics:

    • Attribute Source: Marketing Cloud
    • Dimension: Chrome & Safari Visitors

    For comparison, you might add an OR rule to see all visitors to a site section, such as Patio & Furniture.

  • View the results.

    The resulting rule is a defined audience comprising Chrome & Safari users who visited Home & Garden. The Patio & Furniture segment provides additional insight into all visitors visiting that site section.

    Historical Estimate: (Dotted circle) Represents rules created based on Analytics data.

    Actual Audience: (Solid circle) Any rule created that has 30 days of data from audience management. When the audience management data reaches 30 days, the line becomes solid and represents actual numbers.

    After the data collection completes for the specified period, the circles combine to show a defined audience.

  • After defining the rules, click Save.

    After the audience is saved, it is available for other solutions. For example, you can include a shared audience in a Target activity.

For example, you can create a board for marketing reports and analytics. After you run a marketing report, you can share it to a Marketing Cloud board.

A First Time Experience board is available in the Marketing Cloud interface to help you understand feeds, cards, and boards.

• In the left navigation menu, click Boards.
  • Click to display the Create Board page.
  • Fill in the fields:

    Board Title: Specify the desired name for the board.

    Add User: (Optional) From the drop-down list, select a user with whom you want to share the board, then click Add. Add additional users, as desired. If you do not share your board with additional users, the board is private.

    As you share the board with additional users, the Team section updates to display the names of users with whom you have shared the board.

    To remove a user, click the Remove icon () next the user's name.

  • Specify the permission for added users (Editor, Viewer, or Owner).
  • Click Create.

You can edit the board in the future to share it with additional users or to change its title. For more information, see .

You can also create a new board while pinning a card. For more information, see .

• In the left navigation menu, click Boards.
  • Click the desired board to display its contents.
  • Click to display the Edit Board page.

  • Edit in the fields as needed:

    Board Name: Edit the name of the board.

    Invite: From the drop-down list, select a user with whom you want to share the board, then click Add.

    Or

    Click the Remove icon () next a user's name to un-share the board from that user.

  • Click Save.

• On the Board where you pinned the report, click Edit.

  • From the Add User drop-down list, select a user with whom you want to share the board.
  • Under Owner, select the permissions that you want this user to have:
    • Editor: Lets the user edit a board but not, for example, delete it.
    • Viewer: Prevents the user from editing the board.
    • Owner: Provides full rights to the board.
  • Click Add.

You can annotate each card and share them to a board. When you pin cards to a board, you are collecting and curating ideas that have a common theme.

You can create a card from many kinds of assets, such as from a file (PDF, Excel), a report, a video, and more.

Supported file types include:

  • .png
  • .jpeg
  • .gif
  • .xlsx
  • Marketing Cloud help and KB topics (see Embedding Content)
Shareable Data from Marketing Cloud Solutions

You can share content from Marketing Cloud solutions. Sharing creates a card from the content, which you add to a board. You and users in your organization can annotate the cards to share and discuss the data. The following table lists the type of information that you can share as a card.

Solution Description

Analytics

You can use cards to share the following reports:

  • Customer Conversion reports
  • Customer Traffic reports
  • Video reports (not including Overview reports)
  • Marketing Channel reports (not including Overview reports)
  • Visitor Profile reports
  • Traffic Sources reports
  • Products reports (not including Funnel reports)
  • Visitor Retention reports
  • Site Content reports (not including Links and PageNotFound reports)
  • Site Metrics reports (not including Funnel reports)

Cards support the following filters:

  • Report type
  • Segmentation
  • Date Range
  • Granularity
  • Metrics
  • Breakdown
  • Basic Search
  • Shown As
  • Graph Type
  • Normalize Data

Social

  • Campaigns
  • Social Author
  • Social Platform
  • Social Asset ID
  • Social Post Type
  • Social Post Link
  • Tracking Code
  • Authors
  • Platforms/Properties
  • Active Terms
  • Terms Country
  • Terms
  • Languages

Target

Campaign spotlight.

Media Optimizer

  • Portfolio Simulation (line chart)
  • Portfolio Model Accuracy (line chart)
  • Portfolio Spend Recommendation (scatter plot)
  • Portfolio Spend Recommendation Distribution (pie chart)
  • Home Page Portfolio Pie Gadget (pie chart)
  • Home Page Portfolio Line Gadget (line chart)
  • Home Page Portfolio Bar Gadget (bar chart)
  • Home Page Search Engine Pie Gadget (pie chart)
  • Home Page Search Engine Line Gadget (line chart)
  • Home Page Dual Line Gadget (line chart)

Experience Manager

N/A

Help topics

On a help page you want to share, click Share to Adobe Marketing Cloud in your browser's Bookmark toolbar.

• or into a solution.
  • .

  • To create a card from a file, open the board, then click Create Card from File. ()

    Browse to locate the file.

  • Alternatively, share an asset from a solution.

    For example, see .

    The Share button in solutions lets you create a card from the asset and share it to a Marketing Cloud board. You can also create a board when sharing an asset from within a solution.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Share an Analytics report to the Marketing Cloud

text.text:
• .

  • In the left navigation, click Analytics.

  • On the Welcome to Adobe Analytics page, locate Reports & Analytics, then click Launch.

  • Run a report, then click Share.

    This example shows a Key Metrics Report. You can also share reports from Social and ad hoc analysis.

  • In the new card, create a Board or specify an existing Board.

  • (Optional) Click the Card to annotate.

  • Add optional comments, then click Share to publish the report to the Marketing Cloud.

    Continue by sharing the board with other users.

• In the left navigation menu, click Feed, then click the desired card to open it.
  • Click Draw Annotation.

  • Use your mouse on a computer or your finger on a tablet to draw an arrow or a circle on the card to highlight the desired element.

jcr:content.jcr:title: Pin a card to a board

text.text:
• In the left navigation menu, click Feed.

    Alternatively, click Boards, then click the desired board to display its contents.

  • Hover your cursor over the card, then click Pin Card to Board.

    On a tablet, long-press the desired card to display additional options.

  • Select the board(s), then click View to see the card in the selected board.

  • Click View to display the board to which you pinned the card.

You can also create a new board during this process.

  1. Click to create a new board on which you can pin the card.

  2. In the Create Board field, specify the name for the new board, then click OK.

• In the left navigation menu, click Feed.

    Or

    In the left navigation menu, click Boards, then click the desired board to display its contents.

  • Right-click the desired card to display additional options

    On a tablet, long-press the desired card to display additional options.

  • Click to delete the card from the board.

The Feed might be empty the first time you log in to the Marketing Cloud. As you create boards and cards, and other users share content with you, the Feed will automatically populate to help you and your team members keep up to date.

Cards in the Feed are ordered from newest to oldest. Newly created cards automatically display in the top left corner of the Feed. Additionally, cards with new annotations from you or other users are moved to the top left corner to make them more prominent. You cannot manually re-order cards in the Feed.

In the feed, you can monitor the latest changes in your assets and campaign's performance at a glance, and navigate to a more detailed information of each individual card.

https://marketing-beta.adobe.com/resources/help/core/core_services.html

Raw analytics data collected in the real-time audiences framework does not recognize the IP obfuscation available for Adobe Analytics customers. Customers who currently use IP obfuscation in Analytics are encouraged to review their data collection and privacy policies before requesting real-time audience enablement to avoid violating these policies.

Join the Marketing Cloud

  1. SKUs (Latest AN SKU, Target Standard recommended)

    You must have the Adobe Analytics Solution SKU (not the legacy SiteCatalyst SKU). The Analytics Solution SKU became available in 2013.

    You must also have an Adobe Target Solution SKU (Target Standard, Target Premium, or Target Classic).

  2. Request access to the MAC (opt-in page)

Use DTM to Implement the Marketing Cloud ID

  1. If you are not using DTM, implement the MACID as part of your Analytics deployment.
  2. Ensure that you are using CIDs

Modernize Your Analytics implementation

  1. RDC
  2. Either add an AN tool in DTM, or update your JS libraries, including the Visitor API.

Modernize your Target implementation

  1. If on DTM, add the Target tool
  2. Update your mbox library
  3. Request access to A4T

Request access to Audiences (provisioning)

Follow up with what you can do now that you're enabled.

Old from here down

Verify that you have an <b>Analytics</b> solution SKU.

You must have the Adobe Analytics Solution SKU (not the legacy SiteCatalyst SKU). The Analytics Solution SKU became available in 2013.

You must also have an Adobe Target Solution SKU (Target Standard, Target Premium, or Target Classic).

Contact Adobe to opt-in.

Complete the Adobe Marketing Cloud Interface Opt-In Application.

Completing the form notifies the Adobe Customer Provisioning Team (CPT) to provision your account. Then, the CPT notifies the Account Manager you specified on the form. Your Account Manager then contacts you.

Once enabled as an administrator, you can access the Tools page in the Marketing Cloud, where you can:

  • Create users
  • Create groups
  • Invite users to the Marketing Cloud
  • Link solution accounts to Adobe IDs, which enables single sign-on

See for information about administrating the Marketing Cloud.

Verify that you are on Regional Data Collection Service (RDC)

If your data collection domain is omtrdc.net, or if your CNAME is mapped to omtrdc.net, you are on RDC.

See Transitioning to RDC.

If you are using first-party cookies, see CNAME and the Visitor ID Service.

Configure the Marketing Cloud ID service

Perform the following JavaScript implementation steps and update specified implementation files:

  1. Implement the Marketing Cloud ID Service Implementation.

    Perform the steps described in the JavaScript Deployment (VisitorAPI.js) table in Marketing Cloud ID Service Implementation.

  2. Update your existing s_code to version H.27 or later, or your existing AppMeasurement.js to version 1.3 or later.

    These files are available for download in the Code Manager.

    If necessary, see the Analytics Implementation reference guide for information about a JavaScript implementation.

Start using Analytics for Target reporting

Refresh the mbox.js implementation for Target (version 48 or later).

See Implement Analytics for Target.

https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/target/a4t/c_integrating_target_with_analytics.html

Request access to the audience service

Complete the Audiences Services Access Request form.

Share audiences to the Marketing Cloud

The Marketing Cloud Audience Services is the interface that lets you create audiences, combine existing audiences to create composite audiences, and view all shared audiences.

See .

Upload and share customer attributes to the Marketing Cloud

If you capture enterprise data in a customer resource management (CRM) database, you can upload the data into a customer attribute data source in the Marketing Cloud.

See Customer Attributes.

BETA URL

In Tools, drag the Share to Adobe Marketing Cloud button to your browser's bookmark toolbar.

When you are on a web page that supports embedded content (such as help topics), click Share to Adobe Marketing Cloud in the toolbar.

Marketing Cloud > Help > Exchange

https://wiki.corp.adobe.com/display/marketingcloud/Marketing+Cloud+Exchange

https://wiki.corp.adobe.com/display/marketingcloud/Marketplace+Implementation#MarketplaceImplementation-Anonymousvsauthenticatedexperience

  • Download SDKs, read documentation, and submit applications to Digital Marketing for review.
  • Customers can search, select, and install Digital Marketing extensions.
  • Administrators can configure downloaded applications.
  • Review developer submissions, browse application, and comment or rate each application.
  • Decline or approve applications.
  • Publish in the Marketing Cloud.
  • Search and filter by category, company, type, user, and more.

See Marketing Cloud Exchange for more information.

Using the Share feature in solutions, you can pin a report to a Marketing Cloud board with a single click. This means designers or agencies who are creating digital assets no longer need to email these deliverables to their clients.

Marketing Cloud solutions include:

Solution Description Capabilities Benefits

Adobe Analytics

Get real-time analytics across online and offline channels to continuously improve the performance of marketing activities.

  • Real-time web, social and mobile analytics
  • Advanced, ad hoc segmentation
  • Data integration with offline and third-party sources
  • Align marketing initiatives with business objectives
  • Gain real-time insights into customer behavior
  • Drives conversion and relevant consumer experiences

Adobe Target

Test and target digital experiences to maximize business results.

Paves a path from simple testing to targeting to true segmentation and optimization through:

  • A/B and multivariate testing
  • Rules-based targeting
  • Automated decision-making and targeting
  • Increase web and mobile site conversations
  • Create differentiated personalized experiences
  • Optimize customer engagement and loyalty

Adobe Social

Manage social marketing with a comprehensive platform that enables social listening, publishing, and analytics.

  • Manage social content and activities across multiple social networks and profile pages
  • Listen and respond to customer conversations in real time
  • Create social campaigns and track performance with integrated analytics
  • Scale social across the enterprise and retain oversight at an executive level
  • Identify trends, opportunities, and threats pertinent to your brand
  • Connect the dots between social interactions and business results

Adobe Experience Manager

Organize, manage, and deliver creative assets and other content across digital marketing channels.

  • Digital asset management
  • Web content management
  • Social communities
  • Improve market and brand perception
  • Share and collaborate on digital assets and campaigns
  • Improve marketing and IT agility operational excellence

Adobe Media Optimizer

Manage, forecast, and optimize your media mix to deliver peak return on your investment.

  • Cross-channel optimization
  • Search engine marketing management
  • Display and social advertising management
  • Determine the most effective overall marketing mix
  • Drive higher ROI within each marketing channel
  • Optimize customer interactions across channels

Adobe Campaign

Plan and execute orchestrated campaigns across all channels.

  • Plan and execute cross-channel campaigns from a single environment
  • Manage plans, offers, activities, budgets and results
  • Market to your customers individually based on a centralized, real-time customer profile including preferences, purchase behavior, loyalty and more
  • Improve customer satisfaction and retention, and reduce opt-out rates
  • Increase revenue and business performance by automating and optimizing personalized campaigns
  • Make the most of each customer touch point with timely and effective remarking, cross-sell and up-sell communications and every step of the customer lifecycle

Solution Capability Names

Marketing Cloud

The Adobe Marketing Cloud interface brings Adobe's Digital Marketing solutions together.

At .marketing.adobe.com, you can log in, share, assets, and collaborate in one virtual, private space dedicated to your projects.

The following capabilities are shared services within the Marketing Cloud.
